definitions.definition: ( uncountable ) The part of anything that hangs loose , having no strain upon it.
examples: the slack of a rope or of a sail

definitions.definition: ( countable ) A tidal marsh or shallow that periodically fills and drains.
( uncountable , psychotherapy ) Unconditional listening attention given by client to patient .
Attributive form of slacks ( “ semi-formal trousers ” ) .

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The part of anything that hangs loose , having no strain upon it.
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) A tidal marsh or shallow that periodically fills and drains.
( uncountable , psychotherapy ) Unconditional listening attention given by client to patient .
Attributive form of slacks ( “ semi-formal trousers ” ) .

definitions.definition: ( rail transport ) A temporary speed restriction where track maintenance or engineering work is being carried out at a particular place.

main_definition: ( rail transport ) A temporary speed restriction where track maintenance or engineering work is being carried out at a particular place.

definitions.definition: ( countable ) A valley, or small, shallow dell ; a sag or saddle in a ridge .

A flat-bottomed, hollow zone within a sand-dune system that has developed over impervious strata, sometimes due to erosion or blow-out of the dune system; its flat base level is therefore close to or at the permanent water-table level, and therefore has rich, marshy flora, with Salix species (willows) as typical woody colonisers.

main_definition: ( countable ) A valley, or small, shallow dell ; a sag or saddle in a ridge .
secondary_definitions: A flat-bottomed, hollow zone within a sand-dune system that has developed over impervious strata, sometimes due to erosion or blow-out of the dune system; its flat base level is therefore close to or at the permanent water-table level, and therefore has rich, marshy flora, with Salix species (willows) as typical woody colonisers.
